channel.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
channel.description:
# Snowcrest Has Arrived to the Kingdoms!
## General
* Improvement to game over checks. * Added screenshots of the rooms to the class cards. Thanks to the people who were asking others to describe their room. I really like having to waste my time because you don't want to actually play the game. * 3 new armors and 3 new weapons for the holiday season (limited time promos).
## Quality of Life * An icy touched player's message will now be the same color as dead chat, but their name will remain blue.
## King * Removed the notification players receive when the King sends a guard to them. * Added a new King that the Reaper & Possessor become called the Psycho King. They will keep their objective and Guards will become an unlimited killing ability. Can be used on yourself to make you night immune. Cannot spawn at the beginning of the game.
## Possessor * Possess now has 3 uses.
## Reaper * Now only takes 1 soul to revive. * Icy Touch now uses 2 souls to activate and now blocks voting in addition to its previous effects.
## Sorcerer * New passive Perception - You will not attack targets that are death immune or guarded by the knight. You will attack the Inquisitor if they are not being guarded. * Mage Armor now also grants immunity to poison and bleeding. * Circle of Death is now usable on Night 3.
## Bug Fixes * Debauchery now properly blocks Emerald Potion. * Fixed a bug with Faint Whispers. * Fixed a bug with Debauchery not working. * Some others.

item.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
Who’s that riding in the sleigh?

Who’s that firing along the way?

Who’s roughing up bums on Christmas day?

Psycho King, Psycho King, Psycho King!

Read full topic

item.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Ellie:

Added a new King that the Reaper & Possessor become called the Psycho King. They will keep their objective and Guards will become an unlimited killing ability. Can be used on yourself to make you night immune. Cannot spawn at the beginning of the game

Finally. The Psycho King should just be always night immune though.

Possessor: This is a good start, but it’s still a bit weak. Puppet strings should happen instead of the target’s main ability, and redirection and occupation immunity shouldn’t be the same thing. Redirection immunity should be a separate passive(which possessor should have)

Sorcerer: Everything is good except for the circle of death change. It should be usable at all times, it’s not that overpowered. Also, inquisitor should be removed or completely reworked. Hardcounters are bad for the game

NuclearBurrito:

In the next patch you should think about giving the invoker occupy immunity.

Agreed, but invoker could use a bit more(like making chains of corax different from just a weaker occupy, and making bewilderment affect all classes)

Read full topic

item.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Neclord
item.description:
Why not just call it “Mad King”? Psycho King doesn’t flow well.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Loudo
item.description:
ThePlex:

Yeh. I know what you mean. I’m glad they really nailed how accurate magic was back then.

I mean, people actually believed in magic back then. Court Wizard is pretty much a Merlin knock off.

Wizards, possessions and death demons don’t feel particularly out of place in a medieval fiction.
Psychological conditions kind of do. If you talk me about a psychotic character, I would think of a gothic novel at the earliest.

But hey, maybe it’s just me. I think Mad King just sounds better.

EDIT: The point I’m trying to make is that the term Psycho is anachronistic, while the idea that magic works isn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.0.13 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
ThePlex:

Yeh. I know what you mean. I’m glad they really nailed how accurate magic was back then.

Well medival fantasy has always had it’s variants… and obviously a lot of fiction, but there’s always at least some level of consistancy within those fictions, generally it is based on what was popular legend/story from those times. A knight flying a dragon is far more immersive for a medival fantisy, than a knight driving a delorian.

Read full topic

Psycho King slightly ruins my immersion, as psychology didn’t exist back in the Middle Ages.

Yeh. I know what you mean. I’m glad they really nailed how accurate magic was back then.
